cards.name: Holistic Wisdom
cards.text: {2}, Exile a card from your hand: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand if it shares a card type with the card exiled this way. (Artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal are card types.)
cards.originalText: {2}, Remove a card in your hand from the game: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand if it shares a type with the card removed this way. (The card types are artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, and sorcery.)

cards.name: Howling Gale
cards.text:
Howling Gale deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player.
Flashback {1}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Howling Gale deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player.
Flashback {1}{G} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Ivy Elemental
cards.text: Ivy Elemental enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.flavor: In the gardens of the centaurs, many travelers have mysteriously vanished while admiring the elaborate topiaries.
cards.originalText: Ivy Elemental comes into play with X +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.name: Krosan Archer
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
{G}, Discard a card: Krosan Archer gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Krosan Archer may block as though it had flying.
{G}, Discard a card from your hand: Krosan Archer gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Krosan Avenger
cards.text:
Trample
Threshold — {1}{G}: Regenerate Krosan Avenger. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: She'd have a fearsome reputation if she left any survivors.
cards.originalText:
Trample
Threshold {1}{G}: Regenerate Krosan Avenger. (Play this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Krosan Beast
cards.text: Threshold — Krosan Beast gets +7/+7 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Those who see the squirrels go underground in the winter aren't ready for what emerges in the spring.
cards.originalText: Threshold Krosan Beast gets +7/+7. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Leaf Dancer
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: A leaf dancer sweeps through the forest like a spring breeze, evading even the sharpest eyes and ears.
cards.originalText: Forestwalk

cards.name: Metamorphic Wurm
cards.text: Threshold — Metamorphic Wurm gets +4/+4 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Only a handful have seen it transform. Or, from the wurm's perspective, only a mouthful.
cards.originalText: Threshold Metamorphic Wurm gets +4/+4. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Moment's Peace
cards.text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Flashback {2}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Flashback {2}{G} (You may play this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then remove it from the game.)

cards.name: Muscle Burst
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is 3 plus the number of cards named Muscle Burst in all graveyards.
cards.flavor: As strong as a centaur's will.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is 3 plus the number of Muscle Burst cards in all graveyards.

cards.name: Nantuko Disciple
cards.text: {G}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
Unanswered prayers are themselves answers.
—Nantuko teaching
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Nantuko Elder
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}{G}.
cards.flavor:
Plant a field with wishes, and you will grow more wishes.
—Nantuko teaching
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {1}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Nantuko Mentor
cards.text: {2}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is that creature's power.
cards.flavor:
That which grows without roots cannot be uprooted.
—Nantuko teaching

rulings.text: The value of X is determined when the ability resolves. The value will not change over time.

cards.originalText: {2}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is that creature's power.

cards.name: Nantuko Shrine
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player creates X 1/1 green Squirrel creature tokens, where X is the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as that spell.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a spell, that player puts X 1/1 green Squirrel creature tokens into play, where X is the number of cards in all graveyards with the same name as that spell.

cards.name: New Frontiers
cards.text: Each player may search their library for up to X basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then each player who searched their library this way shuffles it.
cards.flavor: Spreading a blanket of growth to warm a weary world.
cards.originalText: Each player may search his or her library for up to X basic land cards and put them into play tapped. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.

cards.name: Nimble Mongoose

Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor: Faster than a cobra's bite.
cards.originalText:
Nimble Mongoose can't be the target of spells or abilities.
Threshold Nimble Mongoose gets +2/+2. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Nut Collector

Threshold — Squirrel creatures get +2/+2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token into play.
Threshold All Squirrels get +2/+2. (You have threshold as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Overrun
cards.text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
The dance of angry feet
—Nantuko expression meaning
"stampede"

rulings.text: Overrun affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Piper's Melody
cards.text: Shuffle any number of target creature cards from your graveyard into your library.
cards.flavor: Those who follow nature's path eventually walk in a circle.
cards.originalText: Shuffle any number of target creature cards from your graveyard into your library.

cards.name: Primal Frenzy
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has trample.
cards.flavor:
"Don't dismiss its anger as mindless fury. I assure you, it has purpose."
—Seton, centaur druid
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature has trample.

cards.name: Rabid Elephant
cards.text: Whenever Rabid Elephant becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

Draw a card.

cards.name: Rites of Spring
cards.text: Discard any number of cards. Search your library for up to that many basic land cards, reveal those cards, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You can choose to find fewer basic land cards if you want to.

cards.originalText: Discard any number of cards from your hand. Search your library for that many basic land cards, reveal those cards, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Squirrel Nest
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Create a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token."
cards.flavor: In the Krosan Forest, you've got to keep an eye out for the squirrels.

rulings.text: The land receives this ability and not the actual text. Text-changing effects can be used on this Aura, but would not change this effect if cast on the land.

cards.name: Still Life
cards.text: {G}{G}: Still Life becomes a 4/3 Centaur creature in addition to its other types until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The centaurs' simple magic can undo a basilisk's gaze, but only for a short time.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: {G}{G}: Still Life becomes a 4/3 Centaur creature until end of turn. It's still an enchantment.

cards.name: Verdant Succession
cards.text: Whenever a green nontoken creature dies, that creature's controller may search their library for a card with the same name as that creature and put it onto the battlefield. If that player does, they shuffle their library.

rulings.text: You can choose not to find the card.

If the creature was only a creature as the result of an animation effect, its controller still gets to search for a card with the same name. For example, if an animated Still Life is put into a graveyard, its controller gets to search their library for a card named Still Life.

cards.originalText: Whenever a green nontoken creature is put into a graveyard from play, that creature's controller may search his or her library for a card with the same name as that creature and put it into play. If that player does, he or she then shuffles his or her library.

Draw a card.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

What is a tree?
Slow hard thought.
What is a flower?
Swift soft flesh.
What is a druid?
Both.

cards.text: {3}{G}, {T}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: "With friends like these, who needs people?"

cards.name: Atogatog
cards.text: Sacrifice an Atog creature: Atogatog gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the sacrificed creature's power.
cards.flavor: It relishes old-fashioned family meals.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice an Atog: Atogatog gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the sacrificed Atog's power.

cards.name: Decimate
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, target creature, target enchantment, and target land.
cards.flavor:
"Anyone can admire creation. Only a barbarian sees the beauty in demolition."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

rulings.text: You no longer need four distinct targets for Decimate. If the spell or ability uses the word target in multiple places, the same object or player can be chosen once for each instance of the word "target." For example, you could choose Tree of Tales for both the artifact and the land. You still need a legal target enchantment and creature as well.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact, target creature, target enchantment, and target land.

cards.name: Iridescent Angel
cards.text: Flying, protection from all colors
cards.flavor: She enraptures all, encompasses all, endures all.

rulings.text: This card has Protection from Black, from Blue, from Red, from White, and from Green. This is the definition of "All Colors". This means it is possible to use an effect that removes one color of protection, such as just black, on this card.

cards.originalText: Flying, protection from all colors

Flying

Flying

cards.name: Catalyst Stone
cards.text:
Flashback costs you pay cost up to {2} less.
Flashback costs your opponents pay cost {2} more.
cards.flavor: The gems' incandescence invades the dreams of all who see them.
cards.originalText:
Flashback costs you pay cost up to {2} less.
Flashback costs your opponents pay cost {2} more.

cards.name: Charmed Pendant
cards.text: {T}, Put the top card of your library into your graveyard: For each colored mana symbol in that card's mana cost, add one mana of that color. Activate this ability only any time you could cast an instant. (For example, if the card's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}{B}, you add {U}{U}{B}.)

rulings.text: The ability is still a mana ability (and doesn't use the stack) even though you can only activate it when you could cast an instant.
If you flip over a hybrid card, you get one of either color mana, not both, for each mana symbol.

cards.originalText: {T}, Put the top card of your library into your graveyard: For each colored mana symbol in that card's mana cost, add one mana of that color to your mana pool. Play this ability only any time you could play an instant. (For example, if the card's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}{B}, you add {U}{U}{B} to your mana pool.)

cards.name: Darkwater Egg
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Darkwater Egg: Add {U}{B}. Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Do you thirst for knowledge no matter the cost?"
—Watnik, master glassblower

rulings.text: This is a mana ability, which means it can be activated as part of the process of casting a spell or activating another ability. If that happens you get the mana right away, but you don't get to look at the drawn card until you have finished casting that spell or activating that ability.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Darkwater Egg: Add {U}{B} to your mana pool. Draw a card.

cards.name: Junk Golem
cards.text:
Junk Golem enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Junk Golem unless you remove a +1/+1 counter from it.
{1}, Discard a card: Put a +1/+1 counter on Junk Golem.
cards.originalText:
Junk Golem comes into play with three +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Junk Golem unless you remove a +1/+1 counter from it.
{1}, Discard a card from your hand: Put a +1/+1 counter on Junk Golem.

cards.name: Limestone Golem
cards.text: {2}, Sacrifice Limestone Golem: Target player draws a card.
cards.flavor: Dwarves have been known to take pickaxes to their own creations, hoping to discover treasures within.
cards.originalText: {2}, Sacrifice Limestone Golem: Target player draws a card.

cards.name: Millikin
cards.text: {T}, Put the top card of your library into your graveyard: Add {C}.
cards.flavor: The toymaker frowned in bewilderment. None of his creations had ever sneezed before.

rulings.text: If you activate Millikin's ability while casting a spell, you can't choose to rewind the ability once you see the card that was put into your graveyard.

cards.originalText: {T}, Put the top card of your library into your graveyard: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mirari
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may pay {3}. If you do, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
cards.flavor:
"It offers you what you want, not what you need."
—Braids, dementia summoner

rulings.text: Everything about the original spell is copied, including any decisions made on announcement, such as whether it was kicked or its Buyback cost was paid. Effects on the spell, such as Sleight of Mind or Flashback, are not copied.
If the copied spell requires a target and there are no legal targets, then the copy has the same target (which should be illegal) as the original.
If the spell is countered before the triggered ability resolves, then the ability will make a copy of how the spell looked right before it was countered.
It triggers once per spell, so you can't get multiple copies of a spell using this card. And since this card is legendary, you can't control more than one.
The copy is not "cast" so it will not trigger anything that triggers on a spell being cast.
You choose whether or not to pay when the triggered ability resolves.

You are not required to choose new targets. If you do choose, then the targets must be legal. If you don't change them, the spell is placed on the stack whether or not the targets are legal. The legality of the targets is always checked on resolution of the spell, so the spell may be countered at that time if all of its targets are illegal.

cards.originalText: Whenever you play an instant or sorcery spell, you may pay {3}. If you do, put a copy of that spell onto the stack. You may choose new targets for that copy.

cards.name: Mossfire Egg
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Mossfire Egg: Add {R}{G}. Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Can you feel your instincts overwhelm your reason?"
—Watnik, master glassblower

rulings.text: This is a mana ability, which means it can be activated as part of the process of casting a spell or activating another ability. If that happens you get the mana right away, but you don't get to look at the drawn card until you have finished casting that spell or activating that ability.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Mossfire Egg: Add {R}{G} to your mana pool. Draw a card.

rulings.text: This is a mana ability, which means it can be activated as part of the process of casting a spell or activating another ability. If that happens you get the mana right away, but you don't get to look at the drawn card until you have finished casting that spell or activating that ability.

rulings.text: This is a mana ability, which means it can be activated as part of the process of casting a spell or activating another ability. If that happens you get the mana right away, but you don't get to look at the drawn card until you have finished casting that spell or activating that ability.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Skycloud Egg: Add {W}{U} to your mana pool. Draw a card.

cards.flavor:

—Steamclaw driver
cards.originalText:
{3}, {T}: Remove target card in a graveyard from the game.  
{1}, Sacrifice Steamclaw: Remove target card in a graveyard from the game.
